page.title: 12LANDSCAPE & ECOLOGY,DRAYTON
page.content: The landscape of the area falls into 3 broad categories.To the{North of the Fakenham road there lie large fields of{arable farmland,}with many fields given to the growing of sugar beet,an East Anglian feature. To the {South}there is the{valley}of the river Wensum, surrounded with meadows,some grazing land and the gravel pits at {Taverham.}Along the Fakenham road there is the recent housing development, open spaces here being few and far between.Much of the {natural habitat}of the area has gone with the introduction of intensive farming methods,but the disused railway line provides a{woodland habitat for many species of tree, plant, animal and bird. The{river {valley}is relatively untouched,and the area in general has maintained much of its original rural character.
